content:
TextBlock(citations=None, text='Based on the retrieved information, there were several notable differences in COVID-19 severity between men and women:

1. Inflammatory Markers:
- Men had higher procalcitonin levels (an inflammation index)
- Men with severe illness had higher C-Reactive Protein (CRP) levels
- Men also had a higher Body Mass Index (BMI) in severe cases

2. Women-Specific Observations:
- Women with severe disease had higher International Normalized Ratio (INR) levels
- Women experienced longer hospital stays in severe cases

While the data suggests some differences in how COVID-19 manifested in men and women, the study notes that the sexual composition of the groups was not significantly different. The variations were primarily observed in specific clinical markers and hospital outcomes.

These findings indicate that gender did play a role in COVID-19 severity, with men and women showing distinct physiological responses to the disease, particularly in inflammatory markers and clinical progression.', type='text')

final_output_text:
Based on the retrieved information, there were several notable differences in COVID-19 severity between men and women:

1. Inflammatory Markers:
- Men had higher procalcitonin levels (an inflammation index)
- Men with severe illness had higher C-Reactive Protein (CRP) levels
- Men also had a higher Body Mass Index (BMI) in severe cases

2. Women-Specific Observations:
- Women with severe disease had higher International Normalized Ratio (INR) levels
- Women experienced longer hospital stays in severe cases

While the data suggests some differences in how COVID-19 manifested in men and women, the study notes that the sexual composition of the groups was not significantly different. The variations were primarily observed in specific clinical markers and hospital outcomes.

These findings indicate that gender did play a role in COVID-19 severity, with men and women showing distinct physiological responses to the disease, particularly in inflammatory markers and clinical progression.
